title: PMK Towing Service â€” Site-wide text color palette update

requirements.summary: Update theme text color tokens and align any hard-coded text/link classes so all sections use the new palette consistently (including mobile CTA bar) while keeping content unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: Changing the theme text colors is done primarily via CSS variables in frontend/src/index.css (e.g., foreground, muted-foreground, primary-foreground, secondary-foreground, etc.), so existing Tailwind semantic classes (text-foreground, text-muted-foreground, text-primary, text-secondary-foreground/XX) reflect the updated colors site-wide.
All text remains clearly readable against its background in the main page sections (including hero overlay text, cards, footer, and sticky mobile call bar).
No user-facing text content, phone numbers, or links are changed; this is a visual-only color update.
Dark mode tokens (if present/used) remain coherent and readable after the update.

file_operations.description: Update the light and dark theme CSS variables (e.g., --foreground, --muted-foreground, --primary-foreground, --secondary-foreground, and related semantic tokens) to the new text color palette so Tailwind semantic text classes update site-wide automatically; ensure contrast remains readable on all current section backgrounds and overlays.

Audit header navigation text/link color classes for any hard-coded or non-semantic text colors and adjust to semantic Tailwind classes (e.g., text-foreground, text-muted-foreground, text-primary) as needed so the new palette applies consistently; do not change any labels, phone number, or links.

Audit hero headline, paragraph, and CTA link/button text color classes (including gradient/overlay readability) and adjust only where colors are hard-coded so text remains readable and consistent with the updated theme tokens; do not change any displayed copy or hrefs.

Audit services section headings, descriptions, and the phone link text colors; replace any hard-coded text colors with semantic Tailwind classes where needed to align with updated theme tokens while keeping all content unchanged.
Audit service area section text (titles, list items, and phone link) for hard-coded text/link colors and adjust to semantic Tailwind classes as needed for consistent application of the new palette.
Audit photos section heading/subtitle text classes for any hard-coded colors and align them with semantic Tailwind classes so they reflect the new theme tokens consistently.

Audit contact section headings, supporting text, and phone number/link styling for hard-coded text colors; update to semantic Tailwind classes where needed to keep contrast/readability consistent with the new palette without changing any text or links.

Audit footer text (including secondary-foreground opacity variants and link colors) to ensure they remain readable and consistent after token updates; adjust only hard-coded text color classes to semantic equivalents where necessary while keeping all content/links intact.

Audit the mobile sticky call-to-action bar text/button color classes to ensure readability and consistent use of updated semantic tokens (primary/secondary foregrounds) after the palette change; do not alter phone number or CTA text.
